summary: Removing Homebrew Configs from CLI Release Workflow

message.content: Why didn't cli-release run when my PR got merged into main?

content.text: Let me examine the CLI release workflow to understand why it didn't trigger after your PR merge.

content.text:
name: Release CLI beta

on:
  workflow_run:
    workflows: ['CI']
    types:
      - completed
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  release:
    if: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.conclusion == 'success' }}
    name: Release Beta CLI
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write # to be able to publish a GitHub release
      issues: write # to be able to comment on released issues
      pull-requests: write # to be able to comment on released pull requests
      id-token: write # to enable use of OIDC for npm provenance

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0 # Required for semantic-release to access full git history

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v1
        with:
          bun-version: latest

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Release CLI
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          NPM_CONFIG_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
          PUBLIC_STACK_PROJECT_ID: ${{ secrets.PUBLIC_STACK_PROJECT_ID }}
          PUBLIC_STACK_PUBLISHABLE_CLIENT_KEY: ${{ secrets.PUBLIC_STACK_PUBLISHABLE_CLIENT_KEY }}
        run: bun run cli:release

        run: bun run cli:release

content.text:
The issue is clear: The CLI release workflow (`cli-release.yml`) triggers on `workflow_run` with the `CI` workflow, but the `CI` workflow only runs on **pull requests** (`on: pull_request`), not on pushes to main.

When you merge a PR into main, no CI workflow runs, so there's no completed CI workflow to trigger the CLI release.

You need to modify the CI workflow to also run on pushes to main. Add this to `.github/workflows/ci.yml`:

```yaml
on:
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main
  push:
    branches:
      - main
```

message.content: make the release CLI beta action be manual, so I can run it manually, instead of being autoamtic.

content.text: I'll modify the CLI release beta workflow to be manually triggered instead of automatic.

input.regex:
on:
  workflow_run:
    workflows: \['CI'\]
    types:
      - completed
    branches:
      - main

content.text:
The CLI release beta workflow is now manual. You can trigger it by going to Actions → Release CLI beta → Run workflow in the GitHub UI, or use the GitHub CLI:

```bash
gh workflow run cli-release.yml
```
